frame.name: Statement
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a <fen>Speaker</fen> to address a <fen>Message</fen> to some <fen>Addressee</fen> using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a <fen>Speaker</fen>, a <fen>Medium</fen> may also be mentioned. Likewise, a <fen>Topic</fen> may be stated instead of a <fen>Message</fen>. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as <m>declare</m> and <m>insist</m>.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">I</fex> now <t>declare</t> <fex name="Message">you</fex> <fex name="Message">members of this Society</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">She</fex> <t>said</t> <fex name="Message">that I would be late</fex> .</ex>
<ex>The <t>announcement</t> <fex name="Top">about raffle winners</fex> came <fex name="Medium">across the loudspeaker</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target </t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun. <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> <t>spoke</t> feelingly about what happened.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> made a persuasive <t>statement</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn's</fex> <t>statement</t> was quite persuasive.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to", or as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>reported</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> <fex name="Add">to me</fex> about what happened.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> is the FE that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase. <ex>Evelyn <t>said</t> <fex name="Msg">that she was not ready to leave</fex>.</ex> <ex>Evelyn <t>explained</t> <fex name="Msg">that she had seen him before</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by "about", but in some cases it can appear as a direct object. <ex>Evelyn <t>spoke</t> candidly <fex name="Top">about her past</fex>.</ex> <ex>The teacher <t>mentioned</t> <fex name="Top">the recent campus incidents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> of performing an action.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act whereby the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Bilio <t>commented</t> on the paper <fex name="Mns">by scrawling innumerable post-its in a range of colors and sticking them all over it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The emotional or physical state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> that leads to their speaking. <ex>He <t>wrote</t> <fex name="ICause">in bitterness</fex> of the treatment the Malloreans had given him.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement. <ex>Kim <t>preached</t> to me <fex name="Medium">over the phone</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> during the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>Let's see if you <t>say</t> that <fex name="Dep">sober</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place. <ex>In some <t>remarks</t> <fex name="Place">at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Occasion
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Occasion</fen> is the reason a public <fen>Message</fen> is given. <ex>The <fex name="Occasion">New Year</fex> <t>address</t> was well received.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition:
<def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE indicate that the particular <fen>Message</fen> event referred to is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Most expressions of <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
<ex>A further biography Shadowland by William Arnold, published in 1978, <t>asserted</t> <fex name="par">for the first time</fex> that Farmer had been the subject of a transorbital lobotomy</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Communicative_force
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Group</fen> of <fen>Speaker</fen>s or <fen>Medium</fen>s within which the <fen>Message</fen> is made. <ex>Much would be achieved if these were more <fex name="Group">widely</fex> <t>acknowledged</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Message</fen> event.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an event during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: manen.v
lexUnit.definition: iemand zeggen dat hij of zij iets moet doen, hem of haar aansporen

lexUnit.name: pressen.v
lexUnit.definition: iemand onder druk zetten om iets te doen, hem of haar ertoe dwingen

lexUnit.name: pramen.v
lexUnit.definition: iemand ertoe brengen iets te doen

lexUnit.name: zetten.v
lexUnit.definition: maken dat iets of iemand ergens mee begint

lexUnit.name: aanzetten.v
lexUnit.definition: iemand zodanig beïnvloeden dat die iets gaat ondernemen of bepaald gedrag gaat vertonen

lexUnit.name: opjutten.v
lexUnit.definition: de genoemde tot haast aanzetten en hem of haar daardoor zenuwachtig maken

lexUnit.name: aanmanen.v
lexUnit.definition: nadrukkelijk aansporen aan zijn verplichtingen te voldoen

lexUnit.name: vermoeden.v
lexUnit.definition: op grond van bepaalde aanwijzingen iets als waarheid aannemen

lexUnit.name: gissen.v
lexUnit.definition: trachten tot een conclusie (omtrent iets), een voorstelling (van iets) te komen door de gegevens, mogelijkheden na te gaan

lexUnit.name: veronderstellen.v
lexUnit.definition: iets als waar aannemen en het als uitgangspunt nemen

lexUnit.name: postuleren.v
lexUnit.definition: aannemen dat iets waar is, zonder dat je daar het bewijs van hebt

lexUnit.name: raden.v
lexUnit.definition: proberen achter het genoemde te komen door je vermoedens uit te spreken of door te gokken
